name: MASVS-STORAGE - MASVS-STORAGE-1
description: The app securely stores sensitive data.

rules.description: STORAGE-1: Testing Local Storage for Sensitive Data --> Internal Storage
rules.note:
It is recommended that sensitive files saved to the internal storage should not be accessed by other application, if observed.
Please note that, Modes such asÂ MODE_WORLD_READABLE and MODE_WORLD_WRITEABLE may pose a security risk.

rules.description: STORAGE-1: Testing Local Storage for Sensitive Data --> External Storage
rules.note:
It is recommended that any sensitive data should not be stored in the external storage, if observed.
Please note that, Files saved to external storage are world-readable and it can be used by an attacker to allow for arbitrary control of the application in some scenarios.

rules.description: STORAGE-1: Testing Local Storage for Sensitive Data --> Temporary File Creation
rules.note:
It is recommended that the temporary files should be securely deleted upon their usage, if observed.
Please note that, Creating and using insecure temporary files can leave application and system data vulnerable to attack.

rules.description: STORAGE-1: Testing Local Storage for Sensitive Data --> Input Validation
rules.note:
It is recommended that input validation needs to be applied on the sensitive data the moment it is read back again, if observed.
Please note that, Any process can override the data for any publicly accessible data storage.

rules.description: STORAGE-1: Testing Local Storage for Sensitive Data --> Shared Preferences
rules.note:
It is recommended to use shared preferences appropriately, if observed.
Please note that, Misuse of the SharedPreferences API can often lead to the exposure of sensitive data.
MODE_WORLD_READABLE allows all applications to access and read the file contents.
Applications compiled with an android:targetSdkVersion value less than 17 may be affected, if they run on an OS version that was released before Android 4.2 (API level 17).

rules.description: STORAGE-1: Testing Local Storage for Sensitive Data --> SQLite Database
rules.note:
It is recommended that sensitive data should not be stored in unencrypted SQLite databases, if observed.
Please note that, SQLite databases should be password-encrypted.

rules.description: STORAGE-1: Testing Local Storage for Sensitive Data --> Realm Database
rules.note:
It is recommended that Realm database instances should not be misconfigured, if observed.
Please note that, the database and its contents have been encrypted with a key stored in the configuration file.

It is recommended to use shared preferences appropriately, if observed.
Please note that, Misuse of the SharedPreferences API can often lead to the exposure of sensitive data.
MODE_WORLD_READABLE allows all applications to access and read the file contents.
Applications compiled with an android:targetSdkVersion value less than 17 may be affected, if they run on an OS version that was released before Android 4.2 (API level 17).
